title: Jean Nidetch, Founder Of Weight Watchers, Dies At 91
teaser: Jean Nidetch, the founder of Weight Watchers, has died. Nidetch started the program in 1963 after successfully losing weight with diet advice from a local health clinic. She and her partners sold the company in 1978 for $71 million.
contentencoded: Copyright 2015 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
